stays.location: Hyatt Regency Naha or Renaissance Okinawa Resort
stays.area: Hyatt Regency Naha or Renaissance Okinawa Resort

days.title: Arrival in Osaka
days.tagline: Welcome to Japan: Neon lights and noodle dreams
highlights: Land at KIX after overnight flight. Clear immigration, collect luggage, exchange currency.
Haruka Express train (75 min to Namba, ~2700 JPY pp) or shared shuttle (90 min, ~2000 JPY pp). Recommend Haruka for time efficiency.
Arrive hotel, check in, freshen up. Divide into 3 rooms. Rest briefly.
Walk through neon-lit Dotonbori district. See the famous running Kani Doraku crab sign. Grab casual dinner or street food.
Return to hotel for rest. Jet lag management: try to sleep at local time.

food.meal: Casual street food in Dotonbori (okonomiyaki, takoyaki, ramen)

days.tip: Don't fight jet lag too hard‚Äîlight activity and early sleep help. Stay hydrated!

days.title: Kyoto: Temples & Traditions
highlights: Hotel buffet or konbini stop. Essential for early temple visits.
Famous for 10,000 vermillion torii gates. Arrive early to beat crowds. Hike to the summit (1.5-2h). Incredible photo ops.
Local inari sushi or ramen. Hayato or similar cafes.
Iconic golden temple reflected in pond. Usually crowded but unmissable. Plan 1h visit.
Serene bamboo forest walk (20 min through grove). Visit nearby Tenryu-ji Temple if time permits.
Historic geisha district. Narrow streets, wooden machiya houses, occasional geisha sightings. Dinner at Gion Kappa (tempura/kaiseki).
days.tip: Wear comfortable shoes‚Äîlots of walking. Fushimi is best visited early morning (7am-9am) for fewer crowds.

days.title: Kyoto & Nara: Sacred Deer & Colossal Buddha
days.tagline: 1,300 deer bow for crackers; a bronze Buddha watches silently
highlights: Fuel up for busy day. Nara is day trip from Kyoto.
Train Kyoto‚ÜíNara (45 min). Walk through Nara Park with 1,300 friendly deer. Feed crackers (sold by park vendors). Visit colossal Todai-ji Buddha Hall. UNESCO site. Plan 3.5h.
Kakinoha-zushi (persimmon leaf sushi) or local karage. Nara specialty foods.
Return train (45 min). Visit Kiyomizu-dera temple with wooden stage overlooking city. Beautiful views.
Walk scenic canal-side path, visit Nanzen-ji temple with red gate.
Covered market with 100+ vendors. Sample fresh seafood, pickles, matcha sweets. Browse stalls. Dinner at nearby restaurant.
days.tip: Nara Park deer are friendly but can bite if food is withheld. Buy crackers from vendors. Kiyomizu-dera is on the way back‚Äîefficient route.

days.title: Hiroshima: History & Peace
days.tagline: A city of remembrance, phoenix-like resilience, and perfect okonomiyaki
highlights: Early breakfast, head to Kyoto Station. Shinkansen departure 09:45 (reserved seats, JR Pass covers).
1.5h bullet train. Scenic journey through rural Japan. Bento boxes available on board.
Deeply moving museum documenting WWII atomic bombing. Plan 2h for thorough visit. Recommended for all, emotionally powerful. Audio guides available.
UNESCO site. Gutted building frozen in time. Short walk from museum. Respectful contemplation spot.
30 min ferry from Hiroshima port. Picturesque island approach. Evening arrival.
Visit famous floating torii gate of Itsukushima Shrine (best at high tide, currently early evening). Walk around shrine grounds. Magical atmosphere at sunset.
days.tip: Peace Memorial Museum is emotionally heavy but essential. Plan morning departure from Kyoto. Floating torii is best seen at high tide (check tide times). Okonomiyaki is Hiroshima's signature dish‚Äîdon't miss it.

days.title: Fukuoka: City Charm & Ramen Culture
days.tagline: Where 1,000-year-old temples meet bustling yatai ramen stalls
highlights: Early breakfast before heading to station.
1h Shinkansen journey (JR Pass covers). Arrive at Hakata Station.
Arrive hotel, check in. Lunch at hotel or nearby ramen spot.
25 min train from Hakata. Famous shrine dedicated to scholar-god. Beautiful grounds, lanterns, local market. Plan 2.5h visit.
Large urban park near Fukuoka Castle ruins. Walking path, gardens, museums. Peaceful vibe. Return to city area.

Visit famous yatai (food stalls) in Yatai Yokocho area. Hakata ramen (tonkotsu pork broth, thin noodles, soft-boiled egg). Cramped seating, local vibe, unforgettable. Ippudo or Hakata Issou are alternatives.

food.meal: Lunch + Hakata ramen at yatai stalls

days.tip: Yatai stalls are cramped but authentic‚Äîbe prepared for close quarters with locals. Cash only for most stalls. Hakata ramen is lighter and more refined than other regional styles.

days.title: Kumamoto Day Trip: Castles & Gardens
days.tagline: Japan's most impressive castle and a stroll through paradise gardens
highlights: Early breakfast at hotel. Train to Kumamoto via Hakata Station (50 min on Shinkansen or regular train).
One of Japan's 'Big Three' castles. Massive stone walls, reconstructed keep, panoramic city views. Most impressive castle on the trip. Plan 2h.
Basashi (raw horse meat sashimi)‚ÄîKumamoto's signature dish. If averse, try tonkatsu or yakitori. Restaurant near castle area.
Strolling landscape garden with artificial mountain, pond, tea house. UNESCO recognition. Very serene. Plan 2h for full appreciation.
Active volcanic mountain visible from Kumamoto. If energy permits, short scenic train/bus to viewpoint. Otherwise, relax.
Shinkansen/train return (50 min). Settle into hotel, light dinner.
days.tip: Basashi is safe and delicious‚Äîhighly recommended. Kumamoto Castle is genuinely spectacular. If you skip Mt Aso, you have relaxation time. Garden is serene‚Äîbring comfortable shoes.

days.title: Flight to Okinawa: Tropical Paradise Awaits
days.tagline: Trading castles for coral: welcome to Japan's Caribbean
highlights: Early breakfast, check out. Relax or explore last bits of Fukuoka.
Subway or taxi to Fukuoka Airport (20 min). Check in for flight.
JAL or ANA domestic flight FUK‚ÜíOKA. Direct flight, 2 hours.
Land at Naha (OKA), clear baggage. Arrive in tropical climate (warm, humid). Humidity spike after mainland!
Monorail (Yui Rail) from airport to Naha city (15 min, ~330 JPY pp) or taxi. Hotel is central Naha.
Arrive Hyatt Regency Naha. 3 rooms. Rest, shower, acclimate to tropical climate.
days.tip: Adjust to tropical humidity‚Äîwear light clothes, stay hydrated. Okinawa is relaxed vibe (compared to mainland urgency). Tsuboya is perfect for Ryukyu crafts. If tired from flight, skip optional activities.

days.title: Okinawa North: Marine Wonders & Pineapples
days.tagline: Whale sharks in the world's largest reef tank, sunrise views, and pineapple wine
days.stay: Hyatt Regency Naha or Renaissance Okinawa Resort (beach)
highlights: Tropical buffet breakfast, early start for full day.
Rental car from hotel (¬•5,000/day for group) OR guided tour. Scenic drive north (60 min). Okinawa by car is leisurely and beautiful.
One of world's largest tanks with WHALE SHARKS. Second tank has manta rays. 3h minimum for full experience. Incredible marine life. Indoor (air-conditioned‚Äîrelief from heat!).
Aquarium complex includes park restaurants. Sea urchin (uni), sashimi, fresh seafood noodles. Plan 1.5h for lunch + rest.
Botanical gardens, tropical plants, beach access, outdoor markets. Relaxing alternative to museum fatigue.
South from Ocean Expo (30 min drive). Pineapple farm, pineapple wine tasting, gift shop. Fun, quirky experience. Pick your own pineapple (in season).

food.meal: Fresh seafood lunch at Ocean Expo, casual dinner

days.tip: Whale sharks are the highlight‚Äîarrive early for shortest aquarium lines. Car rental gives freedom for island exploration. Don't miss the sunset at Cape Manzamo. Pineapple Park is fun but touristy‚Äîworth 1h.

days.title: Okinawa Beach Day: Islands, Snorkeling & Sunset
days.tagline: Crystal-clear waters, vibrant coral, and island time
days.stay: Hyatt Regency Naha or Renaissance Okinawa Resort
highlights: Early breakfast, pack reef-safe sunscreen, towels. Head to port for 08:45 boat departure.

Full-day guided boat tour. Visit 2-3 islands (Tokashiki, Zamami popular). Crystal-clear warm water (25¬∞C). World-class snorkeling: sea turtles, tropical fish, coral gardens. Lunch on boat/island. Snorkel gear provided. 5.5h water time.
Dock by 14:30. Shower at hotel, rest 1h. Recover from sun.

If snorkeling feels too intense (or weather issues), spend day at Nirai Beach (calm, family-friendly). Afternoon visit American Village theme park (quirky, Americana architecture, restaurants, shops). Less strenuous option.

Special dinner celebrating Okinawa. Yunangi or Ryukyu Dining for traditional Okinawan cuisine: goya champuru (bitter melon stir-fry), rafute (braised pork belly), umibudo (sea grapes), Orion beer. Toast to trip!

food.meal: Lunch on boat, Okinawan traditional dinner

days.tip: Snorkeling is best day activity in Okinawa‚Äîdon't miss it. Sea turtles are common! Reef-safe sunscreen is essential (coral protection). Okinawan cuisine (goya, rafute, umibudo) is unique and delicious. Celebrate the Okinawa experience!

days.title: Return to Osaka: Modern City Pulse
days.tagline: From island tranquility back to neon energy
highlights: Early breakfast at hotel. Check out. Airport transfer by 09:00.
Monorail or taxi to OKA. Check in for 10:00 flight.
JAL/ANA domestic flight, 2 hours direct. Breakfast on board (or skip). Okinawa fades into memory.
Haruka Express from KIX to Namba (75 min, ~2700 JPY pp). Arrive Hotel Nikko in Dotonbori area.
Settle into final hotel (3 rooms). Relax or grab lunch.
Iconic castle with gardens. Modern interior (elevator), views from top. Plan 1.5h. Less crowded than Kumamoto but impressive.

food.meal: Light lunch, market snacks, casual dinner

days.tip: Osaka Castle is less crowded in late afternoon. Shinsekai is authentic, gritty local culture‚Äînot touristy. Kuromon Market is best for evening energy and fresh seafood samples. Contrast tropical Okinawa with urban Osaka energy.

days.title: Osaka: Final Adventures & Celebration
days.tagline: Last day: aquariums, shopping, skyscraper sunsets, and gratitude
highlights: Leisurely breakfast, no early rush today. Morning to explore.
Sleep in, explore local Dotonbori, browse convenience stores, visit local temples if inspired. No scheduled activities‚Äîflexibility.
One of world's largest aquariums. Giant tank with whale sharks (again!), manta rays, jellyfish. 2h visit. Less crowded than Churaumi but excellent.
Casual meal, rest before afternoon shopping.
Osaka's main shopping districts. Dotonbori (neon chaos), Shinsaibashi (department stores, boutiques), Namba Parks (modern mall). Find souvenirs, gifts, last-minute purchases.
Modern 40-story building with observation deck. Stunning 360-degree city views at sunset. Pre-sunset arrival for golden light photos.
days.tip: Last day‚Äîenjoy without rush. Umeda Sky Building is worth the 1500 JPY entry for sunset views and photos. Farewell dinner should be special (upgrade budget, reserve upscale spot). Reflect on 12 days: temples, castles, ramen, snorkeling, whale sharks, peace.

days.title: Departure: Last Moments of Japan
days.tagline: One last konbini coffee before takeoff
highlights: Final pack. Leave room items in 'to recycle' pile. Charge devices.
Last Japanese breakfast or final convenience store stop (FamilyMart, Lawson, 7-11). Pick favorite snacks for flight. Coffee, onigiri, matcha chocolates.
Check out of 3 rooms. Consolidate luggage (may need help from concierge for excess baggage if shopping heavily).
Group taxis from hotel to KIX (90 min). Scenic drive back through Osaka suburbs and to airport island. Final views of Japan.
International flight check-in, security, last gifts/snacks shopping in airport duty-free.
Gate announcement, boarding for WRO flight. Final Japanese Shinkansen-like precision timing!
days.tip: Final konbini run is tradition‚Äîgrab favorite snacks for flight. Check luggage weight (souvenir limit). Arrive airport early for international flight (3h before). Reflect on 12 days: temple bells, Okinawa waters, castle walls, ramen bowls. Safe travels!

jrPassAnalysis.recommendation: 7-day JR Pass ‚Äî mainland portion is 6 days

Hotels (11 nights).note: 3 rooms / 7 people. Okinawa resort slightly more.

Food.note: Okinawa is slightly cheaper than mainland

budget.note: Excluding international flights. Most affordable option due to shorter JR Pass + cheaper Okinawa dining.

hotels.note: 3 rooms for 7 adults. Okinawa has resort options.
